Contributing to log4cxx Development

Bug Reporting and patch submission

All bugs and patches should be reported using the log4cxx project bug tracker. Bugs and patches against log4cxx-0.9.7 are no longer desired, please check if the behavior exists in the CVS HEAD before submitting a bug or a patch. Patches should be attached to a bug report with the license grant statement selected. Substantial contributions will require the receipt of an Contributor License Agreement before acceptance.

Development Mailing List

Discussion relating to log4cxx development takes place on log4cxx-dev@logging.apache.org. All CVS checkin notifications are also copied to this list.

Mailing List Archives

log4cxx-dev@logging.apache.org is archived at MARC, GMANE, and apache.org (mod_mbox, eyebrowse).

Subscribe

Subscribe to either the list or to the digest list:

  • To subscribe to this list send an e-mail to
    log4cxx-dev-subscribe@logging.apache.org.

  • To subscribe to the digest list sent an e-mail to
    log4cxx-dev-digest-subscribe@logging.apache.org.

Unsubscribe

To unsubscribe send an email to the relevant email address:

  • To unsubscribe from this list send an e-mail to
    log4cxx-dev-unsubscribe@logging.apache.org.

  • To unsubscribe from the digest list sent an e-mail to
    log4cxx-dev-digest-unsubscribe@logging.apache.org.

Posting

Please have a quick read through the guidelines, thanks.

To prevent spam, we require you to be subscribed to the list before posting to it.

This is the log4cxx developer list, it holds discussions relating to the development of log4cxx not the use of log4cxx. If you have a question that begins with the word "How" or you are unsure as the the appropriate list to post to then you probably want to start with the log4cxx-user list.

Post to the list by sending mail to log4cxx-dev@logging.apache.org.

CVS Access

Browsing CVS

Browse log4cxx CVS repository using ViewCVS.

Anonymous CVS Access

Anyone can checkout source code from our anonymous CVS server. To do so, simply use the following commands (if you are using a GUI CVS client, configure it appropriately).

First login to the CVS server as the anonymous user. 

cvs -d :pserver:anoncvs@cvs.apache.org:/home/cvspublic login
password: anoncvs

Then checkout the logging-log4cxx module. 

cvs -d :pserver:anoncvs@cvs.apache.org:/home/cvspublic checkout logging-log4cxx

If you are not familiar with CVS, Jakarta's CVS page may hold many helpful hints.
